other_tests.findings: Histopathological examination showed pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia in the epidermis; neutrophil abscess in the superficial dermis, diffuse lymphocytes, histiocytes, plasma cells, and a few neutrophils infiltrated in the dermis; and multinucleated giant cells. Periodic acid-Schiff stain revealed dark red spores in multinucleated giant cells.

The growth of creamy, brownish-beige colonies typical of Sporothrix spp. was noted. Microculture showed thin septate hyphae with conidia in a dense arrangement at its extremities. The fungal culture was confirmed to be S. globosa by sequencing the ribosomal region ITS1-ITS2 of the rDNA.
Minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) values provided for various antifungal agents.
